name: bbn\Db\Languages\Models\Sql\Formatters

getCreateDatabase.name: getCreateDatabase
getCreateDatabase.summary: Returns the SQL statement to create a database.

arguments.name: database
arguments.description: The name of the database to create.

arguments.name: enc
arguments.description: The character set to use, if any.

arguments.name: collation
arguments.description: The collation to use, if any.

doc.description: Returns the SQL statement to create a database.

params.name: $database
params.description: The name of the database to create.

params.name: $enc
params.description: The character set to use, if any.

params.name: $collation
params.description: The collation to use, if any.

doc.return: The SQL statement to create the database, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.

getCreateDatabase.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to create a database.
   * @param string $database The name of the database to create.
   * @param string|null $enc The character set to use, if any.
   * @param string|null $collation The collation to use, if any.
   * @return string The SQL statement to create the database, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.
   */

getDuplicateDatabase.name: getDuplicateDatabase
getDuplicateDatabase.summary: Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a database.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: ame The name of the database to duplicate.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: ame The name of the new database.

arguments.name: withData
arguments.description: ata Whether to include data in the duplication.

doc.description: Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a database.

params.name: $old
params.description: ame The name of the database to duplicate.

params.name: $new
params.description: ame The name of the new database.

params.name: $with
params.description: ata Whether to include data in the duplication.

doc.return: An array of SQL statements to duplicate the database, or null if the names are invalid.

getDuplicateDatabase.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a database.
   * @param string $oldName The name of the database to duplicate.
   * @param string $newName The name of the new database.
   * @param bool $withData Whether to include data in the duplication.
   * @return null|array An array of SQL statements to duplicate the database, or null if the names are invalid.
   */

getRenameDatabase.name: getRenameDatabase
getRenameDatabase.summary: Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.
getRenameDatabase.description: This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.

description_parts.content: This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.

arguments.name: oldName
arguments.description: ame The current name of the database.

arguments.name: newName
arguments.description: ame The new name for the database.

doc.description:
Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.
This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.

params.name: $old
params.description: ame The current name of the database.

params.name: $new
params.description: ame The new name for the database.

doc.return: An array of SQL statements to rename the database, or null if the names are invalid.

getRenameDatabase.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.

   * @param string $newName The new name for the database.
   * @return null|array An array of SQL statements to rename the database, or null if the names are invalid.
   */

getAnalyzeDatabase.name: getAnalyzeDatabase
getAnalyzeDatabase.summary: Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
getAnalyzeDatabase.description: This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.

description_parts.content: This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.

doc.description:
Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.
doc.return: An array of SQL statements to analyze the database, or null if there are no tables.

getAnalyzeDatabase.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
   * This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.
   * @return null|strin|array An array of SQL statements to analyze the database, or null if there are no tables.
   */

arguments.name: newName
arguments.description: ame The new name for the table.

doc.return: The SQL statement to rename the table, or an empty string if the names are invalid.

getDuplicateTable.name: getDuplicateTable
getDuplicateTable.summary: Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
getDuplicateTable.description: This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.

description_parts.content: This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The name of the source table.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The name of the target table.

arguments.name: withData
arguments.description: ata Whether to include data in the duplication.

doc.description:
Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.

params.name: $source
params.description: The name of the source table.

params.name: $target
params.description: The name of the target table.

params.name: $with
params.description: ata Whether to include data in the duplication.

doc.return: The SQL statements to duplicate the table, or null if the source table does not exist.

getDuplicateTable.comments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
   * This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.
   * @param string $source The name of the source table.
   * @param string $target The name of the target table.
   * @param bool $withData Whether to include data in the duplication.
   * @return null|array The SQL statements to duplicate the table, or null if the source table does not exist.
   */

dummyComments:
/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to create a database.
   * @param string $database The name of the database to create.
   * @param string|null $enc The character set to use, if any.
   * @param string|null $collation The collation to use, if any.
   * @return string The SQL statement to create the database, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to drop a database.
   * @param string $database The name of the database to drop.
   * @return string The SQL statement to drop the database, or an empty string if the name is invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a database.
   * @param string $oldName The name of the database to duplicate.
   * @param string $newName The name of the new database.
   * @param bool $withData Whether to include data in the duplication.
   * @return null|array An array of SQL statements to duplicate the database, or null if the names are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to rename a database.
   * This method first duplicates the old database to the new name and then drops the old database.
   * @param string $oldName The current name of the database.
   * @param string $newName The new name for the database.
   * @return null|array An array of SQL statements to rename the database, or null if the names are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to analyze the current database.
   * This method generates an ANALYZE statement for each table in the database.
   * @return null|strin|array An array of SQL statements to analyze the database, or null if there are no tables.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to create a table, including keys and constraints if specified.
   * @param string $table
   * @param array|null $cfg
   * @param bool $createKeys
   * @param bool $createConstraints
   * @param bool $anonymize
   * @return null|array
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to create a table.
   * @param string $table
   * @param array|null $cfg
   * @return string
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to drop a table.
   * @param string $table The name of the table to drop.
   * @param string|null $database The name of the database, if different from the current one.
   * @return string The SQL statement to drop the table, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to rename a table.
   * This method generates an ALTER TABLE statement to rename the specified table.
   * @param string $table The current name of the table.
   * @param string $newName The new name for the table.
   * @return string The SQL statement to rename the table, or an empty string if the names are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to duplicate a table.
   * This method generates a CREATE TABLE statement for the target table based on the source table.
   * @param string $source The name of the source table.
   * @param string $target The name of the target table.
   * @param bool $withData Whether to include data in the duplication.
   * @return null|array The SQL statements to duplicate the table, or null if the source table does not exist.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to analyze a table.
   * This method generates an ANALYZE statement for the specified table.
   * @param string $table The name of the table to analyze.
   * @return string The SQL statement to analyze the table, or an empty string if the table name is invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to create a column.
   * @param string $table The name of the table.
   * @param string $column The name of the column to create.
   * @param array $columnCfg The configuration for the column.
   * @return string The SQL statement to create the column, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Returns the SQL statement to drop a column.
   * @param string $table The name of the table.
   * @param string $column The name of the column to drop.
   * @return string The SQL statement to drop the column, or an empty string if the parameters are invalid.
   */

/**
   * Return the SQL statement to drop a constraint.
   * @param string $table
   * @param string $constraint
   * @return string
   */
